O Abba Basil the bishop, your coming to us today is welcome, O teacher of piety and pedagogue of the entire inhabited world. The day of your commemoration coincides with the feast of the Circumcision of the Lord, who was incarnate of the Virgin. Come today, all you nations of the believers, to this feast to glorify our Savior, the good Lover of Mankind, to behold Him swaddled in rags and circumcised with human hands, for He accepted pains from His youth. May the defiled heretics be shamed and rejected, as they hear the saying of Paul the Apostle: â€œI, who was circumcised on the eighth day,â€? which indicates that Christ accepted circumcision on the eighth day according to the Law of Moses. Had Christ not been circumcised on the eighth day, the Jews would have gone mad and killed Him in His young age. But He tolerated everything that pertains to humanity, except sin, in order to complete the economy of our salvation, for He had compassion and sought to save the lost sheep.

Title.Language: And on this day, the Martyrdom of the Chaste St.Â Demiana
ÙˆÙ?ÙŠ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø¥Ø³ØªØ´Ù‡Ø§Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù?ÙŠÙ?Ø© Ø¯Ù…ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø©

Text.Language: Come let us praise Jesus Christ and His mother Mary and Michael the angel, and honor the elect virgin, whose name is full of glory, St.Â Demiana, who was full of wisdom from her youth. She loved virginity more than the whole world. This nun and martyr together, fulfilled the law and the commandments. Now, great is your honor and glory, and your high and widespread commemoration is forever, O choice martyr, righteous nun, the select first-born, St.Â Demiana, the chosen and honored bride of Christ. Hail to you, O virgin who is adorned with purity. Hail to you, the chaste, the comely, the martyr, the pure undefiled virgin full of holiness. Hail to the one who was full of grace from her youth. Hail to the blessed among all virgins. Hail to you, O nun who fulfilled the law with asceticism and worship. Hail to you, the only one and beloved of her father, who became a martyr through her. Hail to you, O mother of the forty virgins who became martyrs with you. Blessed are you, lady Demiana, for you have no peer among the virgins. Rejoice, you who have found favor with God in the Church of the firstborn. Through the intercessions of the Mother of God, St.Â Mary, O Lord, grant us the forgiveness of our sins.

Ø¨Ø´Ù?Ø§Ø¹Ø§Øª ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³Ø© Ù…Ø±ÙŠÙ…ØŒ ÙŠØ§Â Ø±Ø¨ Ø§Ù†Ø¹Ù… Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ù…ØºÙ?Ø±Ø© Ø®Ø·Ø§ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø§.
Through the prayers of the elect lady, St.Â Demiana, O Lord, grant us the forgiveness of our sins.
Ø¨ØµÙ„ÙˆØ§Øª Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø®ØªØ§Ø±Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³Ø© Ø¯Ù…ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø©ØŒ ÙŠØ§Â Ø±Ø¨ Ø£ØºÙ?Ø± Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ø®Ø·Ø§ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø§.

Let us worship the Father, who has no beginning, and His unfathomable Son, and the life-giving Spirit, one Godhead. With the power of His providence and abundant mercy upon us, we honor this martyr and true saint, Demiana. Truly, the honorable commemoration of this chaste virgin, Demiana, the choice martyr, has dawned today from the East. The great Abba John (Yoannis), bishop of El-Borollos, said to us thus: "I rejoiced and was delighted to have found the good struggle of this choice martyr, the wise young girl, Demiana, the true virgin." From her youth she loved to be with Christ, in the glory of His everlasting kingdom. Her father built her a great spacious palace, in which the beloved lived with forty virgins, and at the time of the persecution, she restored her father to the faith and tolerated the threat of the emperor, and received severe tortures. She surrendered her soul to the death and her body to the fire. She crushed all the power of the evil enemy, and at the end of this exalted struggle, they severed her head with the sword. She received the incorruptible crown in the kingdom of heavens. The forty saintly virgins who were with her in the palace received martyrdom with her on the same day. On the thirteenth day of Tobe the saint was martyred, and on the twelfth day of Pashons, a church was dedicated in her name. Blessed are you, Demiana, the bride of the Bridegroom, the virgin, select nun and true martyr.
